result.execSummary:
The defendant Dion C Britton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence Credit for 15 days granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
No use or possession of any weapons or firearms.  Agent must approve of sale of weapons or firearms.

No contact with Tina Britton except for family court and child custody proceedings.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Dion C Britton in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following: to count #1
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
60 Days Huber (Credit - 15 DAYS) HUBER WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.

Term of Probation: 1 Years
Conditions of Probation:
No Use or possession of any weapons or firearms
Agent must approve of sale of weapons or firearms
Domestic abuse counseling
No contact with Tina Britton except for family court and child custody proceedings
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge
Costs:  $343.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $200.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Dion C Britton in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek moves for a bail modification.  State objects the bail modification.  Court denies the bail modification.  Court continues the cashbail as fixed.  Defendant is NOT to have any contact by any form with Tina Britton.  

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 10:30 am.
